Function reference version 1.0.0

Reading and writing

read_dta
read_stata
write_dta
Read and write Stata DTA files.
read_sas
write_sas
Read and write SAS files.
read_por
read_sav
read_spss
write_sav
Read SPSS (SAV & POR) files. Write SAV files.

Labelled vectors

SAS, SPSS, and Stata share a simply concept of “labelled” vectors, which are similar to factors but a little more general. The labelled() class provides a natural representaion in R.

as_factor
as_factor.character
as_factor.data.frame
as_factor.factor
as_factor.labelled
Convert input to a factor.
labelled_spss
Labelled vectors for SPSS
is.labelled
labelled
Create a labelled vector.
print_labels
Print the labels of a labelled vector

tagged_na

Both SAS and Stata supported tagged missing values, where a missing value can have multiple “types”, given by an letter from A through Z. tagged_na() provides a convenient way of representing these types of missing values in R by taking advantage of the binary representation of NA.

format_tagged_na
is_tagged_na
na_tag
print_tagged_na
tagged_na
"Tagged" missing values

Remove attributes

There are a number of SPSS/SAS/Stata features that have no direct equivalent in R. Haven preserves them so you can choose what do with them. To simply eliminate them, use one of the zap functions.

zap_empty
Convert empty strings into missing values.
zap_formats
Remove format attributes
zap_labels
Zap labels
zap_missing
Zap special missings to regular R missings
